definition: lit. firebird and phoenix come together (idiom)/fig. a gathering of eminent people
mythical bird related to phoenix
to soar/to glide/variant of 詳|详[xiang2]
surname Feng
phoenix
to gather/to collect/collected works/classifier for sections of a TV series etc: episode
large number of people
river of literacy, sea of learning (idiom); ars longa, vita brevis
lit. the old man lost his horse, but it all turned out for the best (idiom)/fig. a blessing in disguise/it's an ill wind that blows nobody any good
outstanding talent/wise and able person/illustrious individual
lit. to fly one's banner on a solitary tree (idiom); fig. to act as a loner/to stand out/to develop one's own school/to have attitude of one's own
deep rooted and influential
assistance that one gets from another
a thousand tries leads to one success (idiom, humble expr.); Even without any notable ability on my part, I may still get it right sometimes by good luck.
lit. almanac from years back (idiom)/obsolete practice/old-fashioned principle
out of one's mind
(of calligraphy) full of power and grace

to leave a good reputation
cow and famous steed at the same trough (idiom); fig. the common and the great are treated alike
to pander to sb's whims
